name: BoolNetFixpoints

screenshots.caption: A maximal symbolic steady state of a Mapk signaling network. Black and white nodes indicate stable components at activity 1 and 0 respectively. Red nodes indicate components that oscillate asymptotically. The model is taken from Grieco, Luca, et al. "Integrative modelling of the influence of MAPK network on cancer cell fate decision." PLoS computational biology 9.10 (2013): e1003286.

short_description:
BoolNetFixpoints is a prototype Python script that uses BoolNet and Gurobi to compute all maximal symbolic steady states - of which classical steady states are a special case - and all minimal seeds.

More information on the background and applications to modeling regulatory or signal transduction networks can be found in the research article "Computing Symbolic Steady States". A preprint is available at

nbn-resolving.de/urn:nbn:de:0296-matheon-12823
summary: BoolNetFixpoints computes symbolic steady states of Boolean networks
